item.text: On the third day David and his men came to Ziklag. Now the Amalekites had raided the Negev and Ziklag. They attacked Ziklag and burned it.
They took captive the women and all who were in it, from the youngest to the oldest, but they did not kill anyone. They simply carried them off and went on their way.
When David and his men came to the city, they found it burned. Their wives, sons, and daughters had been taken captive.

Then <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> and the <st data-num="05971" class="">men</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> were <st data-num="0854" class="">with</st> him <st data-num="01058" class="">wept</st> <st data-num="05375 06963">loudly</st><n id="2" /> <st data-num="05704 0834">until</st> they could <st data-num="01058" class="">weep</st> <st data-num="0369" class="">no</st> <st data-num="03581" class="">more</st>.<n id="3" />

<st data-num="01732" class="">David’s</st> <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">wives</st> had been <st data-num="07617" class="">taken captive</st>—<st data-num="0293" class="">Ahinoam</st> the <st data-num="03159" class="">Jezreelite</st> and <st data-num="026" class="">Abigail</st> the <st data-num="03761" class="">Carmelite</st>, <st data-num="05037" class="">Nabal’s</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">widow</st>.
David was very upset, for the men were thinking of stoning him; each man grieved bitterly over his sons and daughters. But David drew strength from the Lord his God.
Then David said to the priest Abiathar son of Ahimelech, “Bring me the ephod.” So Abiathar brought the ephod to David.
David inquired of the Lord, saying, “Should I pursue this raiding band? Will I overtake them?” He said to him, “Pursue, for you will certainly overtake them and carry out a rescue!”
So David went, accompanied by his 600 men. When he came to the Wadi Besor, those who were in the rear stayed there.
David and 400 men continued the pursuit, but 200 men who were too exhausted to cross the Wadi Besor stayed there.
Then they found an Egyptian in the field and brought him to David. They gave him bread to eat and water to drink.

They <st data-num="05414" class="">gave</st> him a <st data-num="06400" class="">slice</st> of <st data-num="01690" class="">pressed figs</st> and <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="06778" class="">bunches of raisins</st> to <st data-num="0398" class="">eat</st>. <st data-num="07307" class="">This</st> <st data-num="07725 0413">greatly refreshed</st> him,<n id="1" /> <st data-num="03588" class="">for</st> he had <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="0398" class="">eaten</st> <st data-num="03899" class="">food</st> <st data-num="03808" class="">or</st> <st data-num="08354" class="">drunk</st> <st data-num="04325" class="">water</st> for <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st> and <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="03915" class="">nights</st>.

<st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st> to him, “To <st data-num="04310" class="">whom</st> do <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> belong, and <st data-num="0335" class="">where</st> are <st data-num="0859" class="">you</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">from</st>?” The <st data-num="05288" class="">young man</st> <st data-num="0559" class="">said</st>, “<st data-num="0595" class="">I</st> am an <st data-num="04713" class="">Egyptian</st>, the <st data-num="05650" class="">servant</st> of an <st data-num="06003" class="">Amalekite</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">man</st>. My <st data-num="0113" class="">master</st> <st data-num="05800" class="">abandoned</st> me <st data-num="03588" class="">when</st> I <st data-num="02470" class="">was ill</st> for <st data-num="07969" class="">three</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">days</st>.

<st data-num="0587" class="">We</st> <st data-num="06584" class="">conducted a raid on</st> the <st data-num="05045" class="">Negev</st> of the <st data-num="03774" class="">Kerethites</st>, <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="0834" class="">area</st> of <st data-num="03063" class="">Judah</st>, and <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> the <st data-num="05045" class="">Negev</st> of <st data-num="03612" class="">Caleb</st>. We <st data-num="08313 0784">burned</st> <st data-num="06860" class="">Ziklag</st>.”<n id="1" />
David said to him, “Can you take us down to this raiding party?” He said, “Swear to me by God that you will not kill me or hand me over to my master, and I will take you down to this raiding party.”

So he took David down, and they found them spread out over the land. They were eating and drinking and enjoying themselves because of all the loot they had taken from the land of the Philistines and from the land of Judah.

But <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="05221" class="">struck</st> them <st data-num="05221" class="">down</st> from <st data-num="05399" class="">twilight</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">until</st> the <st data-num="04283" class="">following</st> <st data-num="06153" class="">evening</st>. <st data-num="03808 0376">None</st> of <st data-num="01992" class="">them</st> <st data-num="04422" class="">escaped</st>, <st data-num="03588 0518">with the exception of</st> <st data-num="0702 03967" class="">400</st> <st data-num="05288" class="">young</st> <st data-num="0376" class="">men</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">who</st> <st data-num="07392 05127">got away</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">on</st> <st data-num="01581" class="">camels</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="05337" class="">retrieved</st> <st data-num="03605 0834">everything</st> the <st data-num="06002" class="">Amalekites</st> had <st data-num="03947" class="">taken</st>; <st data-num="01732" class="">he</st><n id="1" /> also <st data-num="05337" class="">rescued</st> his <st data-num="08147" class="">two</st> <st data-num="0802" class="">wives</st>.

There was <st data-num="03808" class="">nothing</st> <st data-num="05737" class="">missing</st>, <st data-num="04480" class="">whether</st> <st data-num="06996" class="">small</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">or</st> <st data-num="01419" class="">great</st>. <st data-num="05704" class="">He retrieved</st> <st data-num="01121" class="">sons</st> and <st data-num="01323" class="">daughters</st>, the <st data-num="07998" class="">plunder</st>, <st data-num="05704" class="">and</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">everything</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">else</st> they had <st data-num="03947" class="">taken</st>.<n id="1" /> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="07725" class="">brought</st> <st data-num="03605" class="">everything</st> <st data-num="07725" class="">back</st>.
David took all the flocks and herds and drove them in front of the rest of the animals. People were saying, “This is David’s plunder!”

Then David approached the 200 men who had been too exhausted to go with him, those whom they had left at the Wadi Besor. They went out to meet David and the people who were with him. When David approached the people, he asked how they were doing.

But all the evil and worthless men among those who had gone with David said, “Since they didn’t go with us, we won’t give them any of the loot we retrieved! They may take only their wives and children. Let them lead them away and be gone!”
But David said, “No! You shouldn’t do this, my brothers. Look at what the Lord has given us! He has protected us and has delivered into our hands the raiding party that came against us.

Who will listen to you in this matter? The portion of the one who went down into the battle will be the same as the portion of the one who remained with the equipment! Let their portions be the same!”
From that time onward it was a binding ordinance for Israel, right up to the present time.
When David came to Ziklag, he sent some of the plunder to the elders of Judah who were his friends, saying, “Here’s a gift for you from the looting of the Lord’s enemies!”

The gift was for those in the following locations:<n id="1" /> for <st data-num="0834" class="">those</st> in <st data-num="01008" class="">Bethel</st>,<n id="2" /> <st data-num="07418" class="">Ramoth Negev</st>, and <st data-num="03492" class="">Jattir;</st>
for <st data-num="0834" class="">those</st> in <st data-num="06177" class="">Aroer</st>, <st data-num="08224" class="">Siphmoth</st>, <st data-num="0851" class="">Eshtemoa</st>,

and <st data-num="07403" class="">Racal</st>; for <st data-num="0834" class="">those</st> in the <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st> of the <st data-num="03397" class="">Jerahmeelites</st> and <st data-num="07017" class="">Kenites</st>;
for <st data-num="0834" class="">those</st> in <st data-num="02767" class="">Hormah</st>, <st data-num="0953b" class="">Bor Ashan</st>, <st data-num="06269" class="">Athach</st>,
and Hebron; and for those in whatever other places David and his men had traveled.
